comments:
This one is hard to reproduce, but if you do some dragging and dropping and switching of breakpoint groupings, eventually the breakpoints views get disposed.

Steps:
1. create some working sets and set some breakpoints in various files.
2. change to a custom nested grouping, like Resource->WS-> BP types
3. drag and drop some of the breakpoints around to different working sets
4. change the bp grouping

Repeat steps 2-4 and evetually you will get the error above.
*** Bug 188460 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 173174 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
suggestion from bug 173174 is that our implementation of equals() and hashCode() may cause the problem.
See also bug 195320 which looks similar and was likely caused by an implementation of equals() and hashCode() where hashcodes changed over time.

Here are the steps I used to reproduce the posted exception:

1. create 2 breakpoint working sets, and set one of them as the default
2. open the bp view and set the organizer to 'breakpoints'
3. create an exception breakpoint
4. set the organizer to 'breakpoint working sets'
5. goto the advanced organizers dialog and add 'breakpoint types' as a child to 'workingsets' on the RHS of the dialog.
6. back in the breakpoints view try to drag the exception breakpoint from one to the other.

you get either the original exception or the one below:

with the fix applied for bug 171463 the hashcode of a working set should now remain static over its use in the view. Continued testing is needed to ensure the problem is now solved (even though the test cases now pass)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 171463 ***
